intro: Platystele stellaris, commonly known as the starry platystele, is a rare and enigmatic member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is an epiphytic plant native to the cloud forests of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, adding to its striking appearance. Its leaves are short and clustered, forming a rosette that helps retain moisture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Platystele stellaris is considered a conservation concern.
